column4: So I'm trying to use the Ubuntu Virtual Machine Manager to set up a virtual machine on a physical disk (so i can boot into it directly later) and it keeps failing to add the drive citing a package i already have anyone have any clue as to why?
what is the package?
python-virtinst? What is the message you are getting?
ok
Traceback (most recent call last):
there should be another line just before the Traceback
http://paste.ubuntu.com/363926/
the heading? k sec
http://paste.ubuntu.com/363927/
what device are you passing to virt-install to create the VM on?
a 500g pata hard disk
on /dev/sde
gotcha... are you passing in the device name or a partition? /dev/sde or /dev/sdeX?
/dev/sde since i want it to have the whole drive
yeah, that would be correct, if you wanted to boot from it later... I'm at a bit of a loss... there's no record of any current issues like this... are you using Xen or KVM? What Ubuntu version?
karmic kvm
64 bit ubuntu if that is an issue
hmmm... me too... I don't have a hdd to hand to try it on at the moment... if I think of anything I'll PM
you could always create it as an img and then dd it to the hdd :)
well i can just install it nativly but i want to be able to virtualize it AND boot into it
so i dont have to have two full installs
i mean i have 2.5tb but still no need to waste space right?
indeed... leave it with me... I'll see if anything springs to mind
it works in virtualbox but i want to do a 64 bit install and vb can only handle 32
